    add local database for development

diff --git a/docker-compose.yml b/docker-compose.yml
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..8578a77
--- /dev/null
+++ b/docker-compose.yml
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+services:
+  postgres:
+    image: postgres:16-alpine
+    container_name: peak-blooms-db
+    restart: unless-stopped
+    environment:
+      POSTGRES_USER: peak_blooms
+      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: peak_blooms_local
+      POSTGRES_DB: peak_blooms
+    ports:
+      - "5432:5432"
+    volumes:
+      - peak_blooms_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
+    healthcheck:
+      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U peak_blooms -d peak_blooms"]
+      interval: 10s
+      timeout: 5s
+      retries: 5
+    networks:
+      - peak_blooms_network
+
+  pgadmin:
+    image: dpage/pgadmin4:latest
+    container_name: peak-blooms-pgadmin
+    restart: unless-stopped
+    environment:
+      PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL: admin@peakblooms.local
+      PGADMIN_DEFAULT_PASSWORD: admin
+    ports:
+      - "5050:80"
+    depends_on:
+      - postgres
+    networks:
+      - peak_blooms_network
+    profiles:
+      - tools
+
+volumes:
+  peak_blooms_data:
+    driver: local
+
+networks:
+  peak_blooms_network:
+    driver: bridge

new file mode 100644
index 0000000..2905949
--- /dev/null
+++ b/docs/LANGUAGE_GUIDE.md
@@ -0,0 +1,76 @@
+
+# Language & Style Guide ‚Äî Peak Blooms
+
+This guide explains how to write for Peak Blooms' website: tone, voice, phrasing, and practical examples. Use this as the single source for site-wide language decisions so copy remains consistent, mission-aligned, and effective for our primary audience: florists, retailers, and event planners.
+
+## Core voice principles
+
+- Professional, not formal ‚Äî expert without being cold. Think: a seasoned trade partner who knows floristry.
+- Warm and supportive ‚Äî approachable guidance for busy professionals.
+- B2B-focused ‚Äî write for business customers who make buying and design decisions, not general consumers.
+- Clear and direct ‚Äî avoid marketing fluff and make the value obvious.
+- Specific, verifiable claims ‚Äî prefer "highest quality" and "freshest flowers" over subjective superlatives like "best".
+
+## Key themes & priority phrases
+
+Use these phrases consistently when they apply:
+
+- "Partner" / "Partnership": emphasizes collaborative relationship.
+- "Highest quality" / "Freshest flowers": quality promise (avoid "best").
+- "Competitive wholesale pricing": price positioning for trade customers.
+- "Sustainable sourcing": values & sourcing claim.
+- "Reliable / Timely delivery": logistics & trust.
+- "Design partner" / "professional-grade": for Inspirations and design resources.
+
+## Structural rules (how to compose copy)
+
+- Lead with the user's benefit. Start with the primary professional value (e.g., quality, reliability, pricing).
+- Be concise. Use short paragraphs and clear headers. B2B readers scan copy quickly.
+- Use active voice for clarity and energy. Prefer "

@@ -1,23 +1,74 @@
-# Application Requirements
+# Peak Blooms Requirements
+
+## Overview
+Peak Blooms is a wholesale flower shop application designed to operate as a clean, efficient B2B e-commerce store while incorporating B2C-like inspirational content to appeal to smaller florist businesses.
+
+## User Roles
+
+### 1. Customer
+- **Access:** Requires approval.
+- **Capabilities:**
+  - View full store with prices.
+  - Add items to shopping cart.
+  - Checkout and purchase.
+  - View inspirational content.
+
+### 2. Admin
+- **Capabilities:**
+  - Manage products and inventory.
+  - Approve or reject new customer account requests.
+  - View analytics and user stats.
+  - Manage content.
+
+### 3. Guest (Unauthenticated/Unapproved)
+- **Capabilities:**
+  - View full store products (catalog mode).
+  - View inspirational content.
+- **Restrictions:**
+  - **Prices:** Hidden.
+  - **Shopping Cart:** Disabled/Hidden.
+  - **Checkout:** Disabled.
+
+## Functional Features
+
+### User Authentication & Approval
+- **Registration:** Users can submit a request for a customer account.
+- **Approval Workflow:** New accounts are pending until approved by an Admin.
+- **Login:** Standard secure login for approved customers and admins.
+
+### Product Catalog & Search
+- **Full Text Search:** Robust search capability to find products easily.
+- **Visibility:** Products are visible to all users.
+- **Pricing:** Visible only to logged-in, approved customers.
+
+### Shopping Experience
+- **Cart:** Functional only for approved customers.

+# Peak Blooms Deployment & Environments Plan
+
+## Overview
+
+Peak Blooms uses a **dev ‚Üí main** branching strategy with separate databases and blob storage per environment. The `dev` branch deploys to Vercel preview environments, while the `main` branch deploys to production. All deployments are handled automatically by Vercel upon git push.
+
+## Environment Strategy
+
+### Development/Preview Environment
+- **Branch:** `dev`
+- **Vercel Deployment:** Preview environment (auto-generated per branch)
+- **Database:** Separate PostgreSQL database (dev database)
+- **Blob Storage:** Separate Vercel Blob storage (dev project/token)
+- **Data Lifecycle:** Throwaway data‚Äîcan be reset and re-seeded at any time
+- **Purpose:** Feature development, testing, experimentation
+- **Accessibility:** Internal team only
+- **Uptime SLA:** None (expected to break frequently)
+
+### Production Environment
+- **Branch:** `main`
+- **Vercel Deployment:** Production environment (`peak-blooms.vercel.app`)
+- **Database:** Separate PostgreSQL database (prod database)
+- **Blob Storage:** Separate Vercel Blob storage (prod project/token)
+- **Data Lifecycle:** **Source of truth**‚Äîdata preserved across deployments
+- **Purpose:** Customer-fa

new file mode 100644

--- /dev/null
+++ b/src/app/auth/layout.tsx
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+import { redirect } from "next/navigation"
+import type { ReactNode } from "react"
+
+import { getCurrentUser } from "@/lib/current-user"
+
+export const metadata = {
+  title: "Sign in ‚Äî Peak Blooms",
+}
+
+export default async function AuthLayout({ children }: { children: ReactNode }) {
+  // If there's a signed-in user for this request, send them home ‚Äî auth pages
+  // should only be accessible to unauthenticated visitors.
+  const user = await getCurrentUser()
+
+  if (user) {
+    // server-side redirect
+    redirect("/")
+  }
+
+  return <>{children}</>
+}

+
+This document describes the new reusable heading utilities added to `src/app/globals.css`.
+
+## Classes added
+
+- `heading-1` ‚Äî largest (page titles)
+- `heading-2` ‚Äî section titles
+- `heading-3` ‚Äî subsection titles
+- `heading-4` ‚Äî smaller headings
+- `heading-5` ‚Äî compact headings
+- `heading-6` ‚Äî smallest heading style
+
+Each class is responsive and uses the project's `font-serif` utility for a refined heading style. They provide consistent font-size, line-height, letter-spacing and weight across the app.

+<

+++ b/docs/price_multiplier.md
@@ -0,0 +1,146 @@
+# Price Multiplier Feature
+
+The Price Multiplier feature allows administrators to adjust all product prices on a per-account basis. This enables flexible pricing strategies such as wholesale discounts, premium markups, or custom pricing for specific customers.
+
+## Overview
+
+Each user account has a `priceMultiplier` field that defaults to `1.0` (standard pricing). When a user views products, adds items to their cart, or places an order, all prices are automatically adjusted by their multiplier.
+
+### How It Works
+
+1. **Base prices** are stored in the database for each product variant
+2. **Adjusted prices** = Base Price √ó Price

2025-11-25.message: Refactor auth, cart, and UI for server-side logic and UX
2025-11-25.author: Phineas Kibbey
2025-11-25.shortDiff:
commit 1b8e816d952b9a2803c8a8eb7681725dab74ff06
Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 25 11:40:07 2025 +0000

    Refactor auth, cart, and UI for server-side logic and UX
    
    Migrates authentication and authorization checks in cart and orders pages to server-side redirects for improved security and SSR. Adds cart count badge to navigation, refactors product card to show pricing/specs per user state, and updates add-to-cart buttons to use toast notifications and router methods. Shop filters now fetch options server-side and display as a horizontal bar on desktop. Adds badge UI component and documents app requirements and standards.

diff --git a/docs/app_requirements.md b/docs/app_requirements.md
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..6b95d43
--- /dev/null
+++ b/docs/app_requirements.md
@@ -0,0 +1,107 @@
+# Application Requirements
+
+This document outlines core requirements and standards that must be followed throughout the Peak Blooms application.
+
+## UI/UX Requirements
+
+### Information Visibility
+
+- **Never hide important information from the UI.** Critical details like pricing, product specifications, variant options, and user status should always be visible to users‚Äînot hidden behind hover states, tooltips, or other interactions.
+
+### User Feedback
+
+- **Always use toast messages instead of alerts.** Use the `toast` function from `sonner` for all user notifications:
+  - `toast.success()` for successful actions (e.g., "Added to cart!")
+  - `toast.error()` for error messages
+  - `toast.info()` for informational messages
+  - Never use browser `alert()` dialogs
+
+### Example Usage
+
+```tsx
+import { toast } from "sonner";
+
+// Success message
+toast.success("Added to cart!");
+
+// Error message
+toast.error("Failed to add item to cart");
+
+// With custom content
+toast.success(`Added "${productName}" to cart!`);
+```
+
+## Component Standards
+
+### Data Fetching
+
+- **Always prefer server-side data fetching over clie

+- **Primary Color (#1F332E):** Use this for your footer, hero banner background (as you intended), or as the main background for darker sections. It conveys elegance and depth.

@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from "next/server";
+import { Resend } from "resend";
+
+const resend = new Resend(process.env.RESEND_API_KEY);
+
+// Determine email domain based on environment
+const emailFromDomain =
+  process.env.NODE_ENV === "development"
+    ? "onboarding@resend.dev"
+    : process.env.EMAIL_FROM_DOMAIN || "onboarding@resend.dev";
+
+export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
+  try {
+    const { email } = await request.json();
+
+    if (!email) {
+      return NextResponse.json(
+        { error: "Email is required" },
+        { status: 400 }
+      );
+    }
+
+    console.log("Attempting to resend confirmation email to:", email);
+    console.log("Using email domain:", emailFromDomain);
+

+# Peak Blooms
+
+Peak Blooms is a modern wholesale flower shop application built with Next.js. It serves as a B2B e-commerce platform with a focus on clean design and inspirational content for florists.
+
+## Documentation
+
+- [Functional Requirements](docs/functional_requirements.md): Details on user roles, features, and application logic.
+- [Style Guide](docs/style_guide.md): Information on the color palette, UI components, and design principles.
+
+## Project Overview
+
+This application is designed to be:
+- **Professional & Modern:** A clean aesthetic distinguishing it from competitors.
+- **Efficient:** Streamlined B2B purchasing workflow.
+- **Inspirational:** Content to engage smaller florist businesses.
+
+### Key Features
+- **Dual User Roles:** Customer (requires approval) and Admin.
+- **Conditional Visibility:** Prices and cart are hidden for guest users.
+- **Full Text Search:** Easy product discovery.
+- **Analytics & Leads:** Built-in stats collection and lead generation.
 
 ## Getting Started

2025-11-23.message: Add centralized icon system and integrate across UI
2025-11-23.author: Phineas Kibbey
2025-11-23.shortDiff:
commit 65fd6a76c3f443e84c2ff08df9cf4f284ba08c23
Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Nov 23 00:56:39 2025 +0000

    Add centralized icon system and integrate across UI
    
    Introduces a new icons helper file re-exporting lucide-react icons with consistent sizing. Updates navigation, buttons, and CTA links to use these icons for improved affordance and visual hierarchy. Enhances accessibility and maintains a clean, modern aesthetic as documented in the style guide.

diff --git a/docs/style_guide.md b/docs/style_guide.md
index ac014c2..af71357 100644
--- a/docs/style_guide.md
+++ b/docs/style_guide.md
@@ -35,3 +35,26 @@ The site aims for a clean, professional, modern, and high-quality aesthetic that
 - **Spacing:** Generous whitespace to maintain a "clean" look.
 - **Grid:** Responsive grid layout for product catalogs.
 - **Imagery:** High-quality flower photography is central to the design.
+
+## Iconography
+
+We use a small, consistent icon system across the UI to improve affordance and visual hierarchy for actions and navigation.
+
+- Library: `lucide-react` (TypeScript-friendly, lightweight, tree-shakeable, Tailwind- and Next.js-friendly). Re-export common icons from `src/components/ui/icons.tsx` so consumers import from a single place.
+- When to use: Navigation items, primary call-to-action buttons, cart link, mobile menu toggles & inline affordances (e.g., search, back, info). Do NOT use icons when the meaning becomes unclear without the text.
+- Sizes & tokens:
+  - Use `h-4 w-4` for small inline icons (nav items, labels).
+  - Use `h-5 w-5` for larger CTAs when needed.
+  - All icon classes should be centralized via `IconSizeClass` in the icons helper file.
+- Placement rules:
+  - Navigation & CTAs: icon on the left (leading), 8px (Tailwind `mr-2`) spacing to keep visual rhythm.
+  - Secondary actions which augment text may use an icon on the right (e.g., chevrons for disclosure).
+- Accessibility:
+  - Decorative icons should

2025-11-23.shortDiff:
commit f85eb764a49727bc5a9b3621e36b15821364566a
Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Nov 23 22:51:03 2025 +0000

    Add Prisma seed script and update DB integration
    
    Introduced prisma/seed.ts for seeding the database and updated prisma.config.ts for new Prisma configuration. Refactored FeaturedCollections and FeaturedProducts components to fetch data from the database instead of static sources. Updated db.ts for new Prisma client usage. Added relevant dependencies for PostgreSQL and Prisma in package.json.

2025-11-23.message: Update next-auth to v5 and fix cart item route params
2025-11-23.author: Phineas Kibbey
2025-11-23.shortDiff:
commit fd2cfe11fe3ca4769e7d7bccc2b518bcbf94802d
Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Nov 23 23:05:32 2025 +0000

    Update next-auth to v5 and fix cart item route params
    
    Upgraded next-auth to version 5.0.0-beta.30 and added nodemailer as a dependency. Refactored cart item PATCH and DELETE API routes to handle async params and fixed usage of id extraction. Removed unnecessary ts-expect-error comment in auth session callback.

2025-11-23.message: Add InspirationSet model and migrate to dynamic data
2025-11-23.author: Phineas Kibbey
2025-11-23.shortDiff:
commit 4927b925c19b5eabf8239fa849aeff446b213382
Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Nov 23 23:47:29 2025 +0000

    Add InspirationSet model and migrate to dynamic data
    
    Introduces the InspirationSet model and migration in Prisma, updates seed data to include inspiration sets, and refactors frontend components to fetch categories, products, and inspiration sets from the database instead of static data. Removes unused generated Prisma files and updates .gitignore to exclude the entire /src/generated directory. Adds Prisma generate to postinstall and configures Prisma seed in package.json.

2025-11-22.message: Add UI button component and utility functions
2025-11-22.author: Phineas Kibbey
2025-11-22.shortDiff:
commit fd3b4e3637bad398e1666ef3819f75c7f4e418ba
Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Nov 22 17:23:35 2025 +0000

    Add UI button component and utility functions
    
    Introduces a reusable Button component with multiple variants and sizes using class-variance-authority and Radix UI Slot. Adds a utility function for merging Tailwind and clsx classes. Updates globals.css for new color variables, theme support, and animation imports. Adds required dependencies and configuration for UI components.
